intro: Diplotaxis virgata var. brevisiliqua, commonly known as the short-stalked doublehead, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a feathery appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
